name: video-downloader
title: Video Downloader
description: Download videos from YouTube, Twitter, Twitch, Instagram, Bilibili and more using yt-dlp CLI
author: vimtor

tools.name: download-video
tools.title: Download Video
tools.description: Downloads a video from a given URL

tools.name: extract-transcript
tools.title: Extract Video Transcript
tools.description: Extracts the transcript/subtitles from a video URL as Markdown

preferences.name: homebrewPath
preferences.title: Homebrew Path
preferences.description: Path to the Homebrew executable. You can enter `which brew` to terminal to find its path.

preferences.name: ytdlPath
preferences.title: yt-dlp Path
preferences.description: Path to the yt-dlp executable. You can enter `which yt-dlp` to terminal to find its path.

preferences.name: ffmpegPath
preferences.title: ffmpeg Path
preferences.description: Path to the ffmpeg executable. You can enter `which ffmpeg` to terminal to find its path.

preferences.name: ffprobePath
preferences.title: ffprobe Path
preferences.description: Path to the ffprobe executable. Usually installed along with ffmpeg. You can enter `which ffprobe` to terminal to find its path.

preferences.name: autoLoadUrlFromClipboard
preferences.title: Auto Load URL from Clipboard
preferences.description: Automatically load the URL from the clipboard when the command is executed
preferences.label: Enable

preferences.name: autoLoadUrlFromSelectedText
preferences.title: Auto Load URL from Selected Text
preferences.description: Automatically load the URL from the selected text when the command is executed
preferences.label: Enable

preferences.name: enableBrowserExtensionSupport
preferences.title: Enable Browser Extension Support
preferences.description: Enable browser extension support for reading video URLs from the browser
preferences.label: Enable

preferences.name: forceIpv4
preferences.title: Force IPv4 (Experimental)
preferences.description: Force IPv4 for network requests, this can be useful if you have some network issues. But this should be a temporary solution. We might remove this option in the future.
preferences.label: Enable

ai.instructions: After downloading the video, always link the video with [<video title>](<download path>), so the user can easily open it.
